snippet: The government failed to protect asylum seekers locked up in Papua New Guinea during riots that left one man dead and others seriously wounded, a parliamentary inquiry concluded.
abstract: Parliamentary inquiry reports that Australian government failed to protect asylum seekers, most of them from Iran and Afghanistan, who were locked up in Papua New Guinea during two days of riots in February 2014.
lead_paragraph: The government failed to protect asylum seekers locked up in Papua New Guinea during riots that left one man dead and others seriously wounded, a parliamentary inquiry concluded.

headline.main: Australia Failed to Protect Asylum Seekers, Report Says

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
